meanings.definition: Of or relating to ancient Scandinavian poetry.
meanings.sent1: The skaldic tales were filled with stories of brave warriors and mighty gods.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed an exhibit on skaldic traditions and their impact on Norse culture.
meanings.sent3: The skaldic style of poetry made the audience feel like they were living in the past.
meanings.sent4: Her skaldic descriptions painted vivid pictures of the rugged Nordic landscapes.
meanings.sent5: The skaldic verses echoed through the halls, transporting listeners to a bygone era.

meanings.definition: A type of verse composed by skalds in Old Norse literature.
meanings.sent1: The skaldic was recited with great reverence during the annual festival.
meanings.sent2: Students studied the intricate patterns of skaldic to understand its structure and meaning.
meanings.sent3: The skaldic competition at the fair drew a large crowd of eager listeners.
meanings.sent4: His skaldic was like music to the ears, captivating all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The skaldic of the ancient bards held the secrets of their time within its lines.
